title: Macao Tourism Retail and Marketing Management Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic marketing theory and retail operations processes
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education based on experiential learning theory and Bloom’s taxonomy, conducted in a microlearning environment utilizing digital devices, with competency achievement measured through summative assessment.

learning_goals: Learners meet ≥4 of 5 customer needs analysis checklist items in ≥3 practice-based simulations within a week and develop a 3-stage sales strategy (problem recognition → solution proposal → proposal writing) based on analysis results.

Learners analyze ≥2 target customer segments using digital marketing tools (Google Analytics, Meta Ads Manager, etc.), create and present one customized promotion plan, and achieve "excellent" ratings in ≥3 of 5 peer evaluation rubric items.

Learners analyze 3 global retail scenarios (e.g., online shopping platforms, multinational stores) in 4-member team-based problem-solving activities, apply cross-cultural communication skills (cultural difference awareness, nonverbal communication, conflict management) to propose solutions, and achieve an average ≥4.0 on peer/instructor evaluations (5-point scale).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
